body_content.explanation: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich:
examples: Healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.
Senior management enjoy certain privileges, such as company cars and health insurance.

body_content.explanation: an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable:
examples: I had the privilege of interviewing Picasso in the 1960s.
It was a real privilege to meet her.

body_content.explanation: the way in which people who are rich, come from a high social class, or belong to a particular race or gender have more advantages in society than people who do not belong to these groups:
examples: My thesis examines the role of societal privilege in the maintenance of health disparities.
Some men will even resort to violence to try to enforce and protect their male privilege.

body_content.explanation: the special right that some people in authority have that allows them to do or say things that other people are not allowed to:
to give an advantage to one person or group of people and not to others:
examples: Since colonization, the country has a history of privileging people who have white skin.
Family endowments were nearly all male-centric, privileging men and their descendants over female lines of descent.

body_content.explanation: to give something more importance than other things:
examples: The new exhibition privileged industry over agriculture.
They do not privilege one approach over the other.
